alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Jessamine; Scott; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 9:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Woodford, southern Scott, northwestern Jessamine and Fayette Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 926 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Versailles, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dunbar High School around 930 PM EDT. Cardinal Hill around 935 PM EDT. Meadowthorpe, U K Arboretum and Chevy Chase around 940 PM EDT. Lexington, Highlands and Northland around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Thoroughbred Acres and Bryan Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
